description: Detects omission or marginalization of local civil rights actions, leaders, and resistance efforts that occurred outside of nationally recognized movements.
core_pattern: Overemphasis on a few iconic figures while erasing grassroots, community-based civil rights efforts across cities, rural regions, and tribal areas.
flags: Only referencing Martin Luther King Jr., Rosa Parks, or Malcolm X in civil rights data
Ignoring regional actions (e.g., Bogalusa Deacons for Defense, Monroe North Carolina self-defense, Asian American Yellow Power movement)
Framing civil rights progress as top-down federal achievement only
consequence: Obscures how resistance arises organically from marginalized communities and how power often resists change locally before federally.
